explanations.text: Hashtbl are OCaml's hashmaps (also called associative arrays or dictionnaries). To create a hashtbl you need to specify an initial size (here 10). Don't worry too much about this as it'll expand by itself if you try to store more than 10 elements. Also note that you always need to pass `~random:true`, as unfortunately the default usage of this function is not secure.
You can add values to your hashtable
`add` updates the value if it already exists
